data.name: RegEx Like a Boss #3:  Different Number Formats
data.description:
Create a Regular Expression that matches valid number in one of two well known formats (`d` is a placeholder for a decimal digit [0-9]):


1. `,` is used to split the integer part in triplets and `.` denotes the start of the fractional part

 E.g. `d,ddd,ddd.ddddddd` 

2. A space is used to split the integer part in triplets and `,` denotes the start of the fractional part
 
 E.g. `d ddd ddd,ddddddd` 
 
Every Number should be valid. Leading/trailing zeros are not allowed.


Matching with `re.match()`

Should match:

```
1
12
124
1,024
2,000,204
3,000.6
8,205,500.4672
0.5
36,000.57
100,000
5
46
10.4444444
10.0000000002
1 024
9 999 352
10,19836
30 000,7302
0,5
47 372
```

Should NOT match
```
0 234
01,124
1 124.12
.5
1025
1,5826,000
,046
100.
2.2.2
10,
10,.5
34 34
3692 38
36 047.
47 .7
0.0000
123.456.789
0 123
023
23 43
123 456,789.01
10.0000
10.0000700

```
An empty String should not match. Leading/trailing whitespaces and other whitespace characters are not allowed. Leading/trailing newlines are irrelevant (could be or not considered; no tests checking for those).
____

This tools may help you:

[Cheat sheet](https://www.rexegg.com/regex-quickstart.html)

[Online tester](https://regex101.com/r/OJ9kDw/1)
